outcomes: Every mintable contribution has a training-trace record
Trace verdict/deltas/certificates are attached to the receipt
Failures are non-minting and leave audit breadcrumbs
invalidators: Receipt mints VCUs without a traceId
Trace verdict is fail but payout is non-zero
Certificate required by tier but missing

outcomes: Data minimization: only required evidence leaves the device/service boundary
Local-first receipts: user can hold receipts locally with selective disclosure
Retention limits and redress path exist and are enforceable
invalidators: PII included in receipts beyond declared policy
No user-facing mechanism to revoke/shareLevel or request deletion where applicable

outcomes: Rate limits, cooldowns, and diminishing returns prevent contribution farming
Multi-review required for L2/L3 minting paths
Concentration monitoring exists (anti-capture telemetry that does not violate data-dignity)
invalidators: A single contributor can mint unbounded VCUs
Minting bypasses multi-review for high-risk nodes
Payout policy changes without provenance and review

outcomes: Dependency graph framing is available for cross-sector plans and promises
Second-order effects are recorded as assumptions and revisited
Critical dependency gaps are detectable before rollout
invalidators: Known critical dependency missing from map
Plan claims resilience without second-order checks

outcomes: Trusted channels exist with rapid, independent follow-up
Channel design resists coercion, doxxing, and retaliation
Public aggregate reporting exists without privacy violations
invalidators: Reports closed without independent confirmation when policy requires it
